title: Plant Manager | 1 of 2
question_text:
A plant manager wants to see if there are different proportions of defective items among the four machines at her automotive plant.
She randomly selects $100$ automobile parts from each of the four machines, as shown in the table below:
MachineABCD
Number of Defective Parts58555166


Is there appropriate evidence the machines are not equal concerning proportions of defective products?

No, in fact there is strong evidence the machines are all equally accurate concerning proportions of defective products.
